faults.name: VI_ERR_A
faults.description:
Voltage output: short-circuit error. The error condition is debounced for 2 ms before the status bit is set.
Current output: open circuit error. The error condition is debounced for 2 ms before the status bit is set.
Current input, loop powered: short-circuit error. A short to ground is detected if the digital input comparator is enabled as described in Current Input Loop Powered section with a trip point of AVDD/2 and the digital output is inverted via the INV_DIN_COMP_OUT bit in the DIN_CONFIGx registers. The debounce time of this error detect is user-programmable via the DEBOUNCE_TIME bits in the DIN_CONFIGx registers.
Current input, externally powered: short-circuit error. A current source >25 mA is detected if the digital input comparator is enabled as described in Current Input Loop Powered section with a trip point of AVDD/2. The debounce time of this error detect is user-programmable via the DEBOUNCE_TIME bits in the DIN_CONFIGx registers.

condition.voltage_out: Voltage output: short-circuit error. The error condition is debounced for 2 ms before the status bit is set.
condition.current_out: Current output: open circuit error. The error condition is debounced for 2 ms before the status bit is set.
condition.current_in_loop: Current input, loop powered: short-circuit error. A short to ground is detected if the digital input comparator is enabled as described in Current Input Loop Powered section with a trip point of AVDD/2 and the digital output is inverted via the INV_DIN_COMP_OUT bit in the DIN_CONFIGx registers. The debounce time of this error detect is user-programmable via the DEBOUNCE_TIME bits in the DIN_CONFIGx registers.
condition.current_in_ext: Current input, externally powered: short-circuit error. A current source >25 mA is detected if the digital input comparator is enabled as described in Current Input Loop Powered section with a trip point of AVDD/2. The debounce time of this error detect is user-programmable via the DEBOUNCE_TIME bits in the DIN_CONFIGx registers.

faults.name: HI_TEMP_ERR
faults.description: High temperature detected. After the die temperature typically reaches 115°C, this bit is asserted.

faults.name: CHARGE_PUMP_ERR
faults.description: Charge pump error detected. This bit is asserted when the AVSS pin rises above −1.65 V.

faults.name: ALDO5V_ERR
faults.description: ALDO5V Power Supply Monitor Error. This bit is asserted when the ALDO5V pin falls below 4.05 V.

faults.name: AVDD_ERR
faults.description: AVDD Power Supply Monitor Error. This bit is asserted when the AVDD pin falls below 9.26 V.

faults.name: DVCC_ERR
faults.description: DVCC Power Supply Monitor Error. This bit is asserted when the DVCC pin falls below 1.93 V.

faults.name: ALDO1V8_ERR
faults.description: ALDO1V8 Power Supply Monitor Error. This bit is asserted when the ALDO1V8 pin falls below 1.35 V.

faults.name: ADC_CONV_ERR
faults.description: ADC Conversion Error. ADC results may be outside the selected measurement range.

faults.name: ADC_SAT_ERR
faults.description: ADC Saturation Error. ADC may be outside the user selected measurement range.

faults.name: SPI_SCLK_CNT_ERR
faults.description: SPI SCLK count error detected. This bit is asserted if an SPI command is applied but 32 SCLKs are not provided.

faults.name: SPI_CRC_ERR
faults.description: SPI CRC error detected. This bit is asserted if an invalid CRC is received.

faults.name: CAL_MEM_ERR
faults.description: Calibration Memory Error. This flag asserts under the following two conditions: When a calibration memory CRC error or an uncorrectable error correcting code (ECC) error is detected on the calibration memory upload. It is not possible to clear this bit if there is a CRC error or uncorrectable ECC error. It is recommended to reset the device and check the supplies in this situation.When there is an attempted SPI access to a register before the calibration memory refresh is complete. Do not address the device until the calibration memory is refreshed. Writing 1 to this bit clears the flag, if the flag is asserted due to this condition.

faults.name: RESET_OCCURRED
faults.description: Reset occurred. This bit is asserted after a reset event, which asserts the ALERT pin after the reset. Write a 1 to this bit to clear the flag. Note that a mask bit is not provided for this bit.

faults.name: OVL1
faults.description: Thermal overload is detected on DOI1

faults.name: OVL2
faults.description: Thermal overload is detected on DOI2

faults.name: OVL3
faults.description: Thermal overload is detected on DOI3

faults.name: OVL4
faults.description: Thermal overload is detected on DOI4

faults.name: CL1
faults.description: Current limit detected on DOI1

faults.name: CL2
faults.description: Current limit detected on DOI2

faults.name: CL3
faults.description: Current limit detected on DOI3

faults.name: CL4
faults.description: Current limit detected on DOI4

faults.name: OWOff1
faults.description: Open-wire fault is detected on DOI1 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: OWOff2
faults.description: Open-wire fault is detected on DOI2 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: OWOff3
faults.description: Open-wire fault is detected on DOI3 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: OWOff4
faults.description: Open-wire fault is detected on DOI4 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: AboveVDD1
faults.description: Above-VDD fault is detected on DOI1

faults.name: AboveVDD2
faults.description: Above-VDD fault is detected on DOI2

faults.name: AboveVDD3
faults.description: Above-VDD fault is detected on DOI3

faults.name: AboveVDD4
faults.description: Above-VDD fault is detected on DOI4

faults.name: SHVDD1
faults.description: Short-to-VDD fault is detected on DOI1 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: SHVDD2
faults.description: Short-to-VDD fault is detected on DOI2 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: SHVDD3
faults.description: Short-to-VDD fault is detected on DOI3 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: SHVDD4
faults.description: Short-to-VDD fault is detected on DOI4 when the high-side switch is in the off state

faults.name: VDDOV1
faults.description: VDD1 supply is higher than the VDD_OVTH threshold voltage (43.5V, typ)

faults.name: VDDOV2
faults.description: VDD2 supply is higher than the VDD_OVTH threshold voltage (43.5V, typ)

faults.name: VDDOV3
faults.description: VDD3 supply is higher than the VDD_OVTH threshold voltage (43.5V, typ)

faults.name: VDDOV4
faults.description: VDD4 supply is higher than the VDD_OVTH threshold voltage (43.5V, typ)

faults.name: VINT_UV
faults.description: Undervoltage on the internal supply for the SPI registers

faults.name: V5_UVLO
faults.description: V5 undervoltage

faults.name: VDD_Low
faults.description: Below VDD_GOOD threshold

faults.name: VDD_Warn
faults.description: Below VDD_WARN threshold

faults.name: VDD_UVLO
faults.description: VDD supply in UVLO; all DOI_ switches turned off

faults.name: ThrmShutd
faults.description: The MAX14906 enters thermal shutdown

faults.name: LossGND
faults.description: The MAX14906 detects loss of GND fault

faults.name: WDogErr
faults.description: SPI or SYNCH watchdog timeout is detected
